intro: Satureja subspicata, commonly known as narrowleaf savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring small, opposite leaves that are narrow and slightly serrated. Its flowers are clustered in dense spikes, producing small, pale pink to purple blooms. Satureja subspicata is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its pungent, aromatic properties.
